au_471796: su                          #you will need to enter

nano /etc/ssh/sshd_config   #you could also use vi

ssh -p [port_number_you_entered_in_step_3] [ip_address_of_server] -l [username]

Explanations about Options.-l:
Specifies the user to log in as on the remote machine. This also may be specified
 on a per-host basis in the configuration file.
Explanations about Options.-Y:
Enables trusted X11 forwarding. Trusted X11 forwardings are not subjected to the
 X11 SECURITY extension controls.
Explanations about Options.-p:
Port to connect to on the remote host. This can be specified on a per-host basis in
 the configuration file.
Explanations about Options.-X:
Enables X11 forwarding. This can also be specified on a per-host basis in a
 configuration file.
